informal_statement: What is the value of$\frac{\log_2 80}{\log_{40}2}-\frac{\log_2 160}{\log_{20}2}?$$\textbf{(A) }0 \qquad \textbf{(B) }1 \qquad \textbf{(C) }\frac54 \qquad \textbf{(D) }2 \qquad \textbf{(E) }\log_2 5$ Show that it is \text{(D)}.
formal_statement:
theorem amc12b_2021_p9:
  shows "(ln 80 / ln 2) / (ln 2 / ln 40) - (ln 160 / ln 2) 
            / (ln 2 / ln 20) = (2::real)"
formal_code:
(*
  Authors: Wenda Li
*)

theory amc12b_2021_p9
  imports Complex_Main
begin

theorem amc12b_2021_p9:
  shows "(ln 80 / ln 2) / (ln 2 / ln 40) - (ln 160 / ln 2) 
            / (ln 2 / ln 20) = (2::real)"
  sorry

end
